ARABIC: وَٱغْفِرْ لِأَبِىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and forgive my father - he was one of the misguided;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Forgive me and my father: He was surely among those who went astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and forgive my father for he is among those who strayed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Forgive my father. He has gone astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And forgive my father* – he is indeed astray.” (His paternal uncle)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And forgive my father, verily, he is of the erring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And forgive my father, for surely he is of those who have gone astray;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and forgive my father, for he is one of those astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And forgive my father. Lo! he is of those who err.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and forgive my father; for he is one of the misguided;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And forgive my father; verily he is of the erring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Forgive my father, for he is one of those who are astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Forgive my father, for that he is among those astray;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And forgive my father, verily he is of the erring;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and forgive my father, for he was among the astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And forgive my father—he was one of the misguided.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:86] And forgive my father, for indeed he is one of those who are astray, by Your relenting to him and forgiving him: this was before it became clear to him [Abraham] that he [his father] was an enemy of God, as mentioned in sūrat Barā’a [Q. 9:114].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And forgive my father) and guide my father through me. (Lo! he is of those who err) he is in error, a disbeliever.
